page.title: 07Recreation
page.content: Forbes Estate owns the fishing rights on the River Don for approximately 3 miles upstream and downstream of Keig Bridge. The water is divided into six beats which are let during the season which runs from 11 February to 31 October for salmon and 15 March to 6 October for brown trout. Two anglers are allowed to fish each beat at any given time. Catches during 1985 were good (approx. 90 salmon) as the heavy rain kept the river level high and allowed the fish to make their run upstream from the river mouth. Dedicated fishers come from all parts of the U.K. to the Don, usually booking the same beat for the same period each year. Some French anglers fish the river regularly as do several U.S. citizens visiting the area.
